entry.value: Split a String into multiple columns
Splits a String into multiple columns by a given splitCharacter e.g. |

%%00010%%00009//************************************%%00010%%00009//Specify the character to split up the String%%00010%%00009//************************************%%00010%%00009final String splitCharacter = "\\|";%%00010%%00010%%00010%%00009//Converts the input RDD with one String column into a RDD with %%00010%%00009//several String columns%%00010%%00009final JavaRDD<Row> result = rowRDD1.map(new Function<Row, Row>(){%%00010 %%00009private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;%%00010 @Override%%00010 public Row call(Row r) throws Exception {%%00010 %%00009//Splits the first String column of the RDD by the splitCharacter%%00010 %%00009final Object[] splits = r.getString(0).split(splitCharacter);%%00010 %%00009//Creates a new row with the split values as column values%%00010 return RowFactory.create(splits);%%00010 }});%%00010%%00009return result;
